alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northern Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 21 at 4:31AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and localized heavy rainfall from thunderstorms is possible. * WHERE...Portions of north central, northeast, and northwest Nevada, including the following areas, in north central Nevada, Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County. In northeast Nevada, Northern Elko County, South Central Elko County, Southeastern Elko County and Southwest Elko County. In northwest Nevada, Humboldt County. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poorly drained areas and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Deep Tropical moisture is forecast to move northward into portions of northern Nye County, Southern Lander and Eureka Counties, White Pine counties and southern Elko County mainly affecting the Ruby Mountains starting late on Saturday lasting at least through Monday morning. The moisture, atmospheric instability, and weak lift associated with the decaying remnants of Hilary will aid in the potential for moderate to heavy rainfall and the potential of localized heavy rainfall from thunderstorms that could lead to flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
